alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 10 at 2:33AM MDT until April 13 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected mainly along and south of Powder River Pass. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible with total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...Bighorn Mountains. * WHEN...The Winter Weather Advisory remains in effect until 3 PM this afternoon. The Winter Storm Watch is in effect from Monday evening through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult at times including over Powder River and Granite mountain passes. Bitter cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility in heavy snow could be reduced to a quarter mile or less. People recreating in the back country could become disoriented and lost.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West
